Godan Verbs (五段動詞) Also known as Group 1 verbs, these verbs have five different stem forms that change according to the verb's ending when conjugated. Here's how to conjugate them:
Non-past (Present and Future): No change for dictionary form (e.g., 書く kaku - to write). Past: Change the final -u to -た or -だ (e.g., 書いた kaita - wrote). Negative: Change the final -u to -わない (e.g., 書かない kakanai - do not write). Te-form: Change the final -u to -て or -で (e.g., 書いて kaite - writing). Potential: Change the final -u to -える (e.g., 書ける kakeru - can write).

Ichidan Verbs (一段動詞) Also known as Group 2 verbs, these verbs are simpler to conjugate because they usually end in -る: Non-past: Dictionary form (e.g., 食べる taberu - to eat). Past: Change -る to -た (e.g., 食べた tabeta - ate). Negative: Change -る to -ない (e.g., 食べない tabenai - do not eat). Te-form: Change -る to -て (e.g., 食べて tabete - eating). Potential: Change -る to -られる (e.g., 食べられる taberareru - can eat).
